JobFullDesc: About the RoleUber is looking for a sharp, results-oriented, analytical operations specialist to join our Brazil Rides Regulatory Strategy & Operations team. If you love scaling processes from one to many, handling sophisticated projects and multiple cross-functional stakeholders, and diving deep into the details to build operational efficiency, then this role is for you. We need a person who will excel at making processes more efficient and automated so as to deliver on key business goals that ensure regulatory compliance and unlock growth.The Regulatory Strategy & Operations Team is responsible for owning, executing, and helping craft the overall compliance strategy for Brazil. The team works to standardize and centralize processes across the country and provide advice to local teams on how to execute their processes more efficiently. The overall goal of everything we do is to ensure safety on Uber’s platform, drive strategy and compliance with regulatory-related requirements, build efficiency and add automation.We are looking for a skilled operator with a strong eye towards efficiency who understands the inherent relationship between regulatory compliance, safety, and growth. The ideal candidate will not only thrive in ambiguous environments but also have strong stakeholder management and interpersonal skills. You will help set the standards for the ridesharing industry and for how Uber operates not only at the country level but at a global scale.What You’ll DoVision: Work closely with business leaders across the company to develop and refine specific functional business strategies related to regulatory compliance, including background checks, document compliance and driver access productsThought Leadership: Work with leadership to set strategic priorities, align regional and company vision, and push the thinking to continue innovatingSubject Matter Expertise: Identify and own specific subject matter or process areas and act as a key point person for any related cross-functional issuesProgram/Project and Stakeholder Management: Be the glue that brings teams together (Finance, Product, Marketing, Public Affairs, Legal, Engineering, People Operations, etc.) to ensure high standards for regulatory operations. Be a hustling multi-tasker, driving cross-functional groups to decisions on strategically meaningful questionsProcess improvement: Identify operational and structural weaknesses and help improve existing or develop new processes to keep us as efficient as possibleScale: Analyze business operations and ensure we are operating at the highest possible scale while also leveraging our in-market resourcesWhat You’ll NeedA minimum of 1 year work experience in startup, strategy, operations, analytics, business development, or a variety of other specialty roles with proven track record in quantitative fieldsClear communicator. You are a clear and concise communicator with the ability to synthesize a lot of information quickly, highlight the meaningful points, and disseminate measurable insightsStakeholder Oriented - There are over 100 commercial and ops team members who depend on the work you lead and being successful means being able to prioritize and lead partners at scaleComfort with ambiguity. You are unfazed by executing on projects where all the information is not always available and priorities can change as more data comes to bearYou never hesitate to roll up your sleeves and seek something hands-on; you persevere when others fall awayOutstanding Excel / data management skillsSQL proficiency is strongly needed.
